Citation.sAbstract: Solubility equilibria of threonine in water/ethanol mixtures were measured in the temperature range between (10  and 46) deg C. Threonine exhibits good solubility in water and is hardly soluble in ethanol. The ternary-phase diagram  of the threonine enantiomers in the solvents used reveals the presence of a conglomerate-forming system. Threonine  shows ideal solution behavior (i.e., heterochiral interactions do not occur in solution). To correlate the measured  data with regard to temperature and solvent composition, a simple empirical approach is proposed. The correlation  presented is of interest for calculation of solubilities when designing crystallization or chromatography-based  processes to separate the threonine enantiomers.
Citation.sTitle: Solubility of Chiral Threonine Species in Water/Ethanol Mixtures
